image.altText: Exterior facade of Launceston's historic Albert Hall, with new development cladding.

props.synopsis: A ratepayers' group is calling for an audit of a major heritage building's $20 million redevelopment for what it says are reported design flaws, rendering it "not fit for purpose".

title.children: Questions over $20m redevelopment to 1890s building in Launceston

image.altText: Packets of Tim Tams and Penguins on a table.

props.synopsis: Food manufacturers are responding to high cocoa prices, and a change to the UK's Penguin biscuit may have all but cemented Australia's Tim Tam as the better of the two.

title.children: UK's rival to the Tim Tam can no longer be called chocolate

image.altText: Dozens of union members with matching t-shirts and placards at a rally.

props.synopsis: A week of strike action by public sector unions has wrapped up with no progress on a new pay deal for thousands across health, education, and more.

title.children: No progress on pay deal as Tasmanian public sector flags more action

image.altText: A woman facing away from camera is given a breast screen

props.synopsis: Just over half of Tasmanian women who should be getting regular breast cancer screening are doing so. But with a key service out of action that number could drop even further putting more women at risk. Airlie Wards talks with reporter Meg Whitfield.

title.children: TassieCast: Is cancer detection at risk for some women?

image.altText: Metro bus

props.synopsis: A bus driver has been stood down and Tasmanian authorities are investigating amid allegations that schoolchildren fled the bus in distress.

title.children: Spilled yoghurt sparks alleged 'terrifying' outburst by bus driver

image.altText: A sign outside a tall fence that says Mary Hutchinson Women's Prison

props.synopsis: The family of a young Aboriginal woman who died while in custody in Tasmania say she will be remembered "as a loving and vibrant individual".

title.children: 'Loving, vibrant': Young Aboriginal woman mourned after death in custody

image.altText: A green cricket helmet sits on a fence at a cricket oval.

props.synopsis: Following the death of 17-year-old Ben Austin, experts, including the former doctor for the Australian cricket team, say more focus needs to be put on neck protection at all levels of the sport.

title.children: Tragic death of teen struck by ball turns spotlight on cricket safety

image.altText: Hundreds of men wearing suits and hats crowded in a street and in buildings.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of ultra-orthodox Jews have shut down one of the busiest junctions at the entrance to Jerusalem in protest against moves to force them to serve in the Israeli military.

title.children: Thousands of ultra-orthodox Israelis protest against military draft

image.altText: Donald Trump and Xi Jinping talk as they stand together.

props.synopsis: The settling of tariffs, a lengthy discussion on the war in Ukraine, and effusive praise for the Chinese leader — here are the main takeaways from the meeting between Donald Trump and Xi Jinping.

title.children: 'An amazing meeting': What you may have missed from the Xi-Trump sit-down

image.altText: Wide view of sporting fields

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old woman has died after being struck by lightning at the Cooroy Sporting Complex on the Sunshine Coast.

title.children: Woman dies after being struck by lightning at Queensland sports complex

image.altText: Garth Hamilton leans forward while seated.

props.synopsis: Some Liberals have questioned whether a backbench meeting on net zero today is a "genuine" attempt at debate on climate policy, with some MPs signalling they will not attend. Follow live.

title.children: Some Liberal MPs to skip net zero meeting in Canberra

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Extended Senate question time will continue unless Labor releases secret report: Pocock
Exclusive: AFP commissioner to sign new policing agreement with PNG
Some Liberal MPs to skip Coalition climate and energy meeting in Canberra

image.altText: Alyssa Healy walks from the field after being dismissed in Women's World Cup semifinal.

props.synopsis: Australia captain Alyssa Healy says her side only have themselves to blame as the defence of their World Cup crown comes to an end.

title.children: Aussies rue batting and fielding mishaps in World Cup semi loss to India

image.altText: the torsos of two young children in school uniforms

props.synopsis: Unveiling its choice for word of the year, Dictionary.com explained that it was not quite sure what six-seven meant.

title.children: Gen Alpha's viral 'six-seven' named word of the year

image.altText: An old photo of a young boy in school uniform.

props.synopsis: Survivors watched on as the ACT took a historic step on Tuesday in passing a bill to overturn a High Court decision that allowed a church to avoid litigation over the actions of one of its priests.

title.children: ACT steps up on holding institutions liable for abusers. Why not NSW?

image.altText: A life-size bust of Julius Caesar.

props.synopsis: It is time to see if you have been paying attention — test your memory of this week's news cycle here.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: History exams, an unusual gift and the 'storm of the century'

image.altText: A woman wearing a hijab resting on a carpet in an outdoors makeshift camp.

props.synopsis: The UN and others are condemning paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, which reportedly attacked civilians as it moved to seize new territory in the North African country.

title.children: US politicians call for Trump to act on 'unspeakable atrocities' in Sudan

image.altText: Paleoart showing a pack of Nanotyrannus brazenly attacks a juvenile T. rex.

props.synopsis: A new analysis of a controversial tyrannosaur fossil reveals the dinosaur wasn't a teenage version of T. rex as once thought, but instead a distinct miniature dinosaur.

title.children: Bloody Mary fossil 'flips decades of T. rex research on its head'

image.altText: People march during a rally, some holding rifles.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is on a revenge tour during his second stint in the White House and now his gaze has shifted to an enemy who once "humiliated" him — Nicolas Maduro.

title.children: Nicolas Maduro 'humiliated' Trump in his first term. Experts say Trump has not forgotten

image.altText: Two men in adark suits – one of them Donald Trump – sit and speak in an ornate room.

props.synopsis: The US president paused all refugee admissions when he took office in January, saying they could only be restarted if established to be in the best interest of the nation.

title.children: Trump sets US refugee cap at 7,500, white South Africans given priority

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: During the initial phase of the search for Gus, divers were called to his family's outback property to search water tanks and dams — one of which will now be drained, police say, to check areas with submerged vegetation.

title.children: Renewed effort to find Gus to focus on dam checked by divers

image.altText: A smiling man stands near a beach with a black top and cap

props.synopsis: Six months ago, Jack Atkinson had little running experience. But this weekend he will tackle the world's largest marathon alongside NRL great Johnathan Thurston and AFL giant Lance 'Buddy' Franklin.

title.children: SA runner to join NRL, AFL greats at New York Marathon

image.altText: Man sitting on hill.

props.synopsis: There are calls for a Senate inquiry into the suicide deaths of Australian doctors amid allegations of untenable rosters and payback for whistleblowers.

title.children: Grieving father calls for inquiry after whistleblower doctor's death

image.altText: Woman stands over terrace railing with Halloween deocrations

props.synopsis: Australians are spending thousands of dollars to celebrate Halloween, with research showing the trend is continuing to grow nationwide.

title.children: Halloween spending set to hit $500m as Australians embrace spooky celebrations

image.altText: large black cloud over water

props.synopsis: Damaging storms are forecast from the New South Wales border, west to the Darling Downs and all the way up the coast to the Capricornia, Mackay and the Central Highlands.

title.children: Queensland braces for severe storms and heatwave conditions

image.altText: An older couple, smiling, sitting on a couch, with arms around one another.

props.synopsis: Specialised accommodation will be built in Curtin to house those living with the nation's deadliest disease.

title.children: Canberra will get its first dementia care village on a sold-off school site

image.altText: A golfer hits a ball out of a bunker.

props.synopsis: The development of a resort at the Kalgoorlie Golf Course — the long-time home of the WA PGA Championship — has hit the rough and could cost ratepayers more than $12 million.

title.children: City gets legal advice on stalled golf resort amid $12.5m commitment

image.altText: A man looking at the camera holding a microphone

props.synopsis: The radio host and youth mental health charity founder has been charged with assaulting several teenagers and young people, according to Queensland authorities.

title.children: Award-winning charity founder charged with assaulting teenagers

image.altText: Ryan stands in front of his organic and sleek modern passive house that's all concrete, big windows, with surprising boulders.

props.synopsis: Five months after Ryan Moody moved into his passive house, we check in to see if the hard work was worth it — and what everyday Australians can take from passive house principles.

title.children: The pros, cons and misconceptions about passive houses

image.altText: Police and people stand near the pyramid of the Louvre museum after the robbery.

props.synopsis: French police have arrested five new people, including a main suspect, over this month's daring jewellery theft from the Louvre museum, the Paris prosecutor says.

title.children: Five new suspects arrested over Louvre heist, Paris prosecutor says

image.altText: the James Hardie Industries (JH) logo is seen displayed on a smartphone screen

props.synopsis: James Hardie has a long history of attempting to avoid its responsibilities. The drama began when the company announced a $14 billion purchase of a rival firm.

title.children: 'Blood on the floor': How James Hardie's board came undone

image.altText: An older woman in a black tshirt standing with a younger woman in a white shirt

props.synopsis: Just three months in 2021, Frank Coleman was the ninth Indigenous death in custody in New South Wales.

title.children: Coroner backs overhaul to prevent more prisoners dying trying to get off drugs

image.altText: Rouse Hill scene pic ambos

props.synopsis: A girl has died after being struck by a car outside a school in Sydney's north-west on Thursday afternoon.

title.children: Girl, 5, dies after being hit by car outside Sydney school

image.altText: A home in ruins as storm is overhead.

props.synopsis: Pictures of the aftermath of Hurricane Melissa, the "storm of the century" that tore through Jamaica, Cuba and Haiti, reveal a trail of damage and displacement.

title.children: Devastating scale of Hurricane Melissa revealed in images
